titleStmt.title: The speech of Charles Pamphlin at his execution in Covent-Garden on Wednesday the 22th of May, 1678, for murdering Lieutenant Dalison taken from his own mouth, by two persons that all the while stood in the cart by him.
titleStmt.author: Pamphlin, Charles, d. 1678.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library.
